title: Rune availability/cost
body: Runes are relatively hard to save for when a new page costs 6300 ip, quints cost 2000 ip etc, it is my belief that there should be a RP implemented way of purchasing a "rune bundle" or something similar, as over 8 accounts the most rune pages I have ever had was 4, the cost is just way too high for a basic part of the game

replies.body:
No.

While I agree that the IP costs of pages and (certain) runes are a bit much (*cough* 820 for 1 mark/seal/glyph *cough*), RP should *NOT* be an option that affects the actual gameplay in the way runes do. LoL is supposed to be free to pay with no pay-to-win, so having a gameplay influencing aspect (like runes) available via the purchasable currency (RP in the case of LoL) is counter-intuitive to a "no pay-to-win" scheme. That said, having rune pages available for RP is also (somewhat) counter-intuitive to a "no pay-to-win" scheme, but I would (personally) be happy if a rune page didn't cost more than the majority of champions.

There is an RP bundle for rune pages, you can buy one for 590 RP or 7 for 2600.

As for the runes themselves, that is why tier 2 runes are 1IP each. They exist to fill out the pages with some stats until you can afford the slightly better stats.

EDIT: As HeartVine mentioned, pay to win has NO place in League of Legends. Runes themselves should never EVER be able to be bought with RP. The pages I am fine with, since they are very expensive and still require a choice of where to put your IP, but the runes must remain IP only to preserve the truly ftp nature of the game.
